article_title: Texas' Lloyd Doggett leads fight on drug prices
article_text:
Texas' Lloyd Doggett leads fight on drug prices

Photo: William Luther, Staff U.S. Rep. Lloyd Doggett, D-Austin, applauds Tuesday morning, March...

WASHINGTON - With Congress unwilling to act, U.S. Rep. Lloyd Doggett is marshaling Democrats to pressure the Obama administration to stem the soaring costs of prescription drugs.

article_metadata.description: WASHINGTON - With Congress unwilling to act, U.S. Rep. Lloyd Doggett is marshaling Democrats to pressure the Obama administration to stem the soaring costs of prescription drugs.  Doggett, D-San Antonio, has stepped up efforts to persuade the National Institutes of Health to take the unprecedented step of breaking patents on high-priced pharmaceuticals developed with taxpayer assistance.  The sharp rise in prescription drug costs - driven in part by spending for specialty drugs like those for cancer and hepatitis C - catapulted the issue into prominence last year.  [...] her mother, Theresa Doege, 88, has difficulty making ends meet.  In a speech April 26 in Washington in front of the liberal Center for American Progress, Doggett referred to "the blizzard of price gouging (that) has been accompanied by a blizzard of lobbying and campaign contributions" by the nation's largest pharmaceutical companies.  "Major pharmaceutical companies have become giant marketing operations, expert at defending their monopoly pricing, expert at public relations, expert at avoiding taxes and wielding political influence," he said in the speech.  In letters this year, Doggett and allies urged the Health and Human Services Department to issue official guidance on the march-in authority, in effect warning manufacturers prone to exorbitant pricing.
article_metadata.author.name: By Bill Lambrecht, SAN ANTONIO EXPRESS-NEWS
